verses.text: Afterward he brought me again unto the door of the house ; and, behold, waters issued out from under the threshold of the house eastward : for the forefront of the house \add stood toward\add* the east , and the waters came down from under from the right side of the house , at the south \add side\add* of the altar.
Then brought he me out of the way of the gate northward , and led me about the way without unto the utter gate by the way that looketh eastward ; and, behold, there ran out waters on the right side.

And when the man that had the line in his hand went forth eastward , he measured a thousand cubits , and he brought me through the waters ; the waters \add were\add* to the ankles.\f + \fr 47.3 \ft the waters were…: Heb. waters of the ankles\f*

Again he measured a thousand , and brought me through the waters ; the waters \add were\add* to the knees. Again he measured a thousand , and brought me through ; the waters \add were\add* to the loins.

Afterward he measured a thousand ; \add and it was\add* a river that I could not pass over : for the waters were risen , waters to swim in , a river that could not be passed over.\f + \fr 47.5 \ft waters to…: Heb. waters of swimming\f* \p
¶ And he said unto me, Son of man , hast thou seen \add this\add*? Then he brought me, and caused me to return to the brink of the river.
Now when I had returned , behold, at the bank of the river \add were\add* very many trees on the one side and on the other.\f + \fr 47.7 \ft bank: Heb. lip\f*

Then said he unto me, These waters issue out toward the east country , and go down into the desert , and go into the sea : \add which being\add* brought forth into the sea , the waters shall be healed.\f + \fr 47.8 \ft desert: or, plain\f*

And it shall come to pass, \add that\add* every thing that liveth , which moveth , whithersoever the rivers shall come , shall live : and there shall be a very great multitude of fish , because these waters shall come thither: for they shall be healed ; and every thing shall live whither the river cometh.\f + \fr 47.9 \ft rivers: Heb. two rivers\f*

And it shall come to pass, \add that\add* the fishers shall stand upon it from En-gedi even unto En-eglaim ; they shall be a \add place\add* to spread forth nets ; their fish shall be according to their kinds , as the fish of the great sea , exceeding many.
But the miry places thereof and the marishes thereof shall not be healed ; they shall be given to salt.\f + \fr 47.11 \ft shall not…: or, and that which shall not be healed\f*

And by the river upon the bank thereof, on this side and on that side, shall grow all trees for meat , whose leaf shall not fade , neither shall the fruit thereof be consumed : it shall bring forth new fruit according to his months , because their waters they issued out of the sanctuary : and the fruit thereof shall be for meat , and the leaf thereof for medicine.\f + \fr 47.12 \ft shall grow: Heb. shall come up\f*\f + \fr 47.12 \ft new: or, principal\f*\f + \fr 47.12 \ft for medicine: or, for bruises and sores\f* \p

¶ Thus saith the Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*; This \add shall be\add* the border , whereby ye shall inherit the land according to the twelve tribes of Israel : Joseph \add shall have two\add* portions.

And ye shall inherit it, one as well as another : \add concerning\add* the which I lifted up mine hand to give it unto your fathers : and this land shall fall unto you for inheritance.\f + \fr 47.14 \ft lifted…: or, swore\f*
And this \add shall be\add* the border of the land toward the north side , from the great sea , the way of Hethlon , as men go to Zedad ;

Hamath , Berothah , Sibraim , which \add is\add* between the border of Damascus and the border of Hamath ; Hazar-hatticon , which \add is\add* by the coast of Hauran.\f + \fr 47.16 \ft Hazar-hatticon: or, the middle village\f*
And the border from the sea shall be Hazar-enan , the border of Damascus , and the north northward , and the border of Hamath. And \add this is\add* the north side.

And the east side ye shall measure from Hauran , and from Damascus , and from Gilead , and from the land of Israel \add by\add* Jordan , from the border unto the east sea. And \add this is\add* the east side.\f + \fr 47.18 \ft from (Hauran, Damascus, Gilead, the land): Heb. from between\f*

And the south side southward , from Tamar \add even\add* to the waters of strife \add in\add* Kadesh , the river to the great sea. And \add this is\add* the south side southward.\f + \fr 47.19 \ft strife: or, Meribah\f*\f + \fr 47.19 \ft river: or, valley\f*\f + \fr 47.19 \ft is the south side southward: or, is the south side toward Teman\f*
The west side also \add shall be\add* the great sea from the border , till a man come over against Hamath. This \add is\add* the west side.
So shall ye divide this land unto you according to the tribes of Israel. \p

¶ And it shall come to pass, \add that\add* ye shall divide it by lot for an inheritance unto you, and to the strangers that sojourn among you, which shall beget children among you: and they shall be unto you as born in the country among the children of Israel ; they shall have inheritance with you among the tribes of Israel.
And it shall come to pass, \add that\add* in what tribe the stranger sojourneth , there shall ye give \add him\add* his inheritance , saith the Lord \nd \+w GOD|strong="H3069"\+w*\nd*.
